questions.text: All are Koch’s postulates except:

options.label: A
options.text: A microorganism should be constantly associated with the lesions of the disease

options.label: B
options.text: It should be possible to isolate the bacterium in pure culture from the lesions

options.label: C
options.text: Inoculation of such pure culture into laboratory animals should reproduce the lesions

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.correct_answer: D. Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Administration of broad-spectrum antimicrobial agent dependably eradicates the organisms and cures the diseases

questions.text: Image depicted below belongs to which of the following?

A child is presented with fever, conjunctivitis and bluish white spot-on buccal mucosa. Four days later, she developed rashes. What is the characteristic feature of the virus that is responsible for this condition?
Identify the organism which shows effacement and attachment of intestinal cells as shown below?
Fever with pneumonia, sputum smear showing broad based budding fungi with double contoured cell wall. What is the diagnosis?
Staph. aureus causes vomiting in 6–8 hours. The mechanism of action is:

A farmer presenting with fever off and on for the past 4 years was diagnosed to be suffering from chronic brucellosis. All of the following serological tests would be helpful in the diagnosis at this state except:

A farmer who is also having dairy farm with history of handling cows, presented to the dermatology OPD with ulcer over forearm with central black eschar. True statement regarding the likely causative organism:
False about mechanism of bacterial toxins:

options.label: A
options.text: Cholera toxin acts by inhibition of guanylcyclase

options.label: C
options.text: Shiga toxin act by inhibiting protein synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Diphtheria toxin act by inhibiting protein synthesis

questions.correct_answer: A. Cholera toxin acts by inhibition of guanylcyclase
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Cholera toxin acts by inhibition of guanylcyclase

questions.text: True about antigenic drift:

options.label: D
options.text: Arises due to frame shift mutations

questions.text: An army jawan posted in remote forest area following a tick bite had fever and headache. His fever was 104 °F and pulse was 70 per min. He had an erythematous lesion of about 1 cm on the leg surrounded by small vesicles, along with generalized lymphadenopathy at the time of presentation to the referral hospital. His blood sample was collected to perform serology for the diagnosis of Rickettsial disease. Which one of the following results in Weil-Felix reaction will be diagnostic in this clinical setting?
EBV receptors is:

A patient presented with complaints of dysphagia. On UGI Endoscopy a diagnosis of esophageal candidiasis was made. The organism obtained from the sample was cultured on a specialized media and the below finding were visible on microscopy of the culture. What phenomenon is shown below?

A patient admitted to an ICU is on central venous line for the last one week. He is on ceftazidime and amikacin. After 7 days of antibiotics, he develops a spike of fever and his blood culture is positive for gram positive cocci in pairs, which are catalase negative. Following this, vancomycin was started but the culture remained positive for the same organism even after 2 weeks of therapy. The most likely organism causing infection is:
A 15-year-old girl had splenomegaly, leucopenia, step ladder pattern fever and died in a few days. Longitudinal ulcers were found in intestine. What should be the probable diagnosis?
A patient presented to the hospital with severe hydrophobia. Corneal scrapings from the patient is obtained. What test should be done on this specimen for a diagnosis of Rabies?

options.label: C
options.text: Antibodies to rabies virus by Indirect Immunofluorescence

questions.text: A 30-year-lady with 3 months history of progressive breathelessness and dyspnea was evaluated. Chest X-ray showing cavitary lesion in lower lobe of lung. Lobectomy was done and histopathology shows the following image, identify the agent and how many layers it will have?
Ziemann dots:

A 12-year-old child presents with fever and cervical lymphadenopathy. Oral examination shows a grey membrane on the right tonsil extending to the anterior pillar. Which of the following medium will be ideal for the culture of the throat swab for a rapid identification of the pathogen?
All are true about Chagas’ disease except:

options.label: A
options.text: Romana's sign is a diagnostic feature of acute Chagas’ disease

options.label: B
options.text: Tsetse fly is the vector (Glossina palpalis)

questions.correct_answer: B. Tsetse fly is the vector (Glossina palpalis)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Tsetse fly is the vector (Glossina palpalis)

questions.text: Neil Mosser reaction or tunica reaction is useful to differentiate between:
questions.correct_answer: A. R. prowazekii and R. typhi
questions.explanation: Ans. A) R. prowazekii and R. typhi

questions.text: All of the following interaction occurs between antigen antibody reaction except:
The following lesions were seen in a child. The patient is suffering from a disease caused by which of these viruses.
Which of the following egg contains three pairs of hooklets and polar filaments but bile nonstained?

A 25-year-old man with painless ulcer on penis. He has h/o contact with commercials sex worker. Dark ground microscopy of the discharge from the lesion has be shown in the picture. Identify the disease.

Patient is presented with cough with rusty sputum. On examination, lower lobe consolidation and bronchial breath sounds were heard. It gives a positive Quellung reaction. What is the probable Gram staining appearance?
Which is the mode of transmission and infective form of the parasite whose egg picture is given below?

options.label: B
options.text: Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.correct_answer: B. Ingestion of egg contaminated in water
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ingestion of egg contaminated in water

questions.text: A 20-year-old male with history of fever and enlarged lymph nodes and sore throat was suspected to have infectious mononucleosis and was ordered a Paul Bunnel test. Which of the following is the principle of the test?

An HIV +ve patient with CD4 Count 20 cells/mm3 came with complaints of headache, mild neck stiffness and weakness suspected Meningitis, lumbar puncture revealed yeast with no pseudohyphae. India ink preparation shows capsule. Diagnosis :
A child with bull neck and membrane over tonsil. What is mechanism of the toxin responsible for this condition?
Women presented with dome-shaped warty lesions with a dimple at center on forehead since 2 months, similar lesions noticed in her daughter (image given) causative agent?
Strawberry cervix is seen in:

A person working in an abattoir presented with a pustule on his hand that progressed to form an ulcer. Smear is taken from the ulcer and sent to laboratory for investigation. Which of the following is the best stain to determine the causative agent of the ulcer?
A hospital worker is found to be HBsAg (+) ve. Further serum investigations showed HBe (+) ve and IgG anti HBc (+) ve. The given hospital worker is

options.label: A
options.text: Acute Hepatitis B patient with High infectivity

questions.correct_answer: C. Chronic infection with high infectivity
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Chronic infection with high infectivity

questions.text: Which one of the following is true?

options.label: C
options.text: Addition of selective substances in a solid medium is called enrichment media

questions.correct_answer: D. Nutrient broth is basal medium
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Nutrient broth is basal medium

questions.text: Which of the following is ovo-viviparous?
Regarding Clostridium perfringens gas gangrene, false is:

options.label: D
options.text: Food poisoning strain of Cl. perfringens produces heat resistant spores

questions.correct_answer: C. Most common toxin is Hyaluronidase
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Most common toxin is Hyaluronidase

questions.text: A 7-month-old infant with the history of incomplete childhood vaccination presents with bouts of spasmodic cough with cyanosis and a typical inspiratory whoop. Which is most appropriate clinical specimen to be collected for the isolation of pathogen?
Winter bottom sign is seen in:
A chronic alcoholic patient is presented with necrotic pneumonia. Sputum culture reveals mucoid lactose fermenting colonies on MacConkey medium. What is the organism?
The following is false about Adenovirus:

options.label: C
options.text: Hemorrhagic cystitis is due to type 11,21

questions.text: Identify the organism from its egg in the picture?
In HIV window period indicates:

options.label: A
options.text: Time period between infection and onset of first symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Time period between infection and detection of antibodies against HIV

options.label: C
options.text: Time period between infection and minimum multiplication of the organism

options.label: D
options.text: Time period between infection and maximum multiplication of the organism

questions.correct_answer: B. Time period between infection and detection of antibodies against HIV
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Time period between infection and detection of antibodies against HIV

questions.text: Pig tapeworm may cause dangerous disease than beef tapeworm because:

A 25-year-old female complains of recurrent rhinitis, nasal discharge and bilateral nasal blockage since 2 years. She has history of asthma and allergy. On examination multiple ethmoidal polyps are noted with mucosal thickening and impacted secretions in both the nasal cavities. Biopsy is taken and the material is cultured which shown the growth of many hyphae with dichotomous branching typically at 45. Which of the following is the most likely responsible organism?

A person presents with pneumonia. His sputum was sent for culture. The bacterium obtained was gram positive cocci in chains and alpha haemolytic colonies on sheep agar. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?

A patient with benign hypertrophy of prostate was admitted in the hospital for 3 weeks. He subsequently developed suspected catheter associated-urinary tract infection. The tip of the catheter was sent for culture and was grown on blood agar. After 24 hours, the blood agar shows the following appearance. What is the likely causative agent for the UTI?
Correct sequence of bacterial growth curve:

options.label: A
options.text: Log phase – Lag Phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

options.label: B
options.text: Lag Phase – Log phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

options.label: C
options.text: Stationary phase – Log phase – Lag Phase – Decline phase

options.label: D
options.text: Lag phase – Exponential phase – Log phase – Death phase

questions.correct_answer: B. Lag Phase – Log phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Lag Phase – Log phase – Stationary phase – Decline phase

questions.text: Which of the following is not caused by Parvovirus:

A 33 years old sexually active male is having urethral discharge since last 8 months along with burning sensation while micturition. Gram staining smear of urethral swab Sample is showing following picture. The causative organism is:
A 30-year-old patient presented with features of acute meningoencephalitis in the casualty. His CSF on wet mount microscopy revealed motile unicellular microorganisms. The most likely organism is:
HBV and HDV false is:

options.label: B
options.text: HDV causes more serious infection d/t superinfection

options.label: C
options.text: HDV cannot infect in absence of HBV

questions.correct_answer: D. HDV is a DNA virus
questions.explanation: Ans. D) HDV is a DNA virus

questions.text: A child with 3 years of age presents with weakness with Hb level <5 g/dL. History of blood loss in stool was present. What would be the causative organism?

A 23-year-old female presents with fever and altered sensorium for two days with the following rash on legs. Her BP is 70/50 mm Hg and neck stiffness is present. Lumbar puncture reveals cloudy turbid CSF with 4200 cells/uL, Protein level 168 and Glucose of 21 mg/dL. Which of the following correctly describes the organism causing this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci (kidney shaped), Oxidase positive

options.label: B
options.text: Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

options.label: C
options.text: Gram Positive cocci catalase negative, bacitracin sensitive

options.label: D
options.text: Gram Positive Diplococci (lanceolate), catalase negative, optochin sensitive

questions.correct_answer: B. Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Gram Negative Diplococci, ferments glucose and maltose

questions.text: A vitreous aspirate from a case of metastatic endophthalmitis on culture yields Gram-positive round to oval cells, 12-14 μm in size. The aspirate on Gram staining shows the presence of pseudohyphae. Which of the following is the most likely etiological agent?

A 23-year-old male had unprotected sexual intercourse with a commercial sex worker. Two weeks later, he developed a painless, indurated ulcer on the glans that exuded clear serum on pressure. Inguinal lymph nodes in both groins were enlarged and not tender. The most appropriate diagnostic test is:

options.label: B
options.text: Dark field microscopy of ulcer discharge

options.label: C
options.text: Giemsa stain of lymph node aspirate

questions.correct_answer: B. Dark field microscopy of ulcer discharge
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Dark field microscopy of ulcer discharge

questions.text: Nontoxigenic C. diphtheriae changes to toxigenic C. diphtheriae by the help of bacteriophage. By which method this conversion occurs?
Identify the vector involved in the spread of disease, whose peripheral smear is as given:
A person has received complete immunization against tetanus 10 years ago. Now he presents with a clean wound without any lacerations from an injury sustained 2.5 hours ago. He should now be given:

options.label: D
options.text: Human Tet globulin and single dose of toxoid

questions.correct_answer: B. Single dose of tetanus toxoid
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Single dose of tetanus toxoid

questions.text: True about polio:

options.label: C
options.text: IM injections and increased muscular activity lead to increased paralysis

options.label: D
options.text: Polio drops given only in < 3 year

questions.correct_answer: C. IM injections and increased muscular activity lead to increased paralysis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) IM injections and increased muscular activity lead to increased paralysis

questions.text: A 65-years-old patient presented to the emergency with high grade fever, chest pain, increased respiratory rate and cough with expectoration. His sputum was sent to the laboratory for gram straining which showed the presence of pus cells and gram-positive cocci in pair. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?

A 40-year-old man underwent kidney transplantation. Two months after transplantation, he developed fever and feature suggestive of bilateral diffuse interstitial pneumonitis. Which of the following is most likely etiologic agent?
The Plasmodium species known for relapse in malaria is:
questions.correct_answer: C. P. vivax and P. ovale
questions.explanation: Ans. C) P. vivax and P. ovale

questions.text: With which of the following of viral hepatitis infection in pregnancy, the maternal mortality is highest:
True about Botulinum toxin:
XDRTB is defined as:

options.label: D
options.text: Resistant to INH + Rifampicin + Amikacin + Ofloxacin

questions.correct_answer: D. Resistant to INH + Rifampicin + Amikacin + Ofloxacin
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Resistant to INH + Rifampicin + Amikacin + Ofloxacin

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy presented with fever and chills for 3 days. On examination he was found to have delayed skin pinch time and dry oral mucosa. A peripheral blood smear revealed the following picture. Identify the pathogen involved:
Farmer presents with the features of high fever, painful inguinal lymphadenopathy, vomiting and diarrhea and hypotension. Which stain will help in the diagnosis?
A patient presented to a STD clinic with painful genital ulcer and painful, soft nonindurated enlarged inguinal lymph node. Identify the pathogen:

A Diabetic patient suffers from a soft tissue infection and microbiological examination reveal the infection been caused by with fungi with aseptate and broad hyphae. Which of the following fungus is responsible for this infection?
